newsitem.title: UK: Thorn remains under pressure after figures.
newsitem.headline: Thorn remains under pressure after figures.

text.p: Shares in Thorn Plc remained under selling pressure on Wednesday after having issued a cautious outlook when the UK electrical retailer and rental firm reported its results earlier this week, dealers said.
The shares were down 9-1/2p to 292-1/2p by 0847 GMT.
"This is still a reflection on the figures," one market maker said referring to today's decline.
"The stock is still trying to find the right level," said another.

On Monday, Thorn reported a modest rise in sales and profits for the first six months to September, its first set of results since its split from music giant EMI. But it issued a cautious statement about its outlook, prompting analysts to reconsider their profit forecasts.
Shares in Thorn have lost some 98p, or about a quarter of their value, since splitting from EMI.
Losses have accelerated recently. Since November 15, the shares have stumbled another 55p, or about 16 percent.
